perturbation.original_text: eDiets shall ensure that the eDiets Content complies with Women.com's editorial guidelines. Women.com will provide eDiets with specific editorial guidelines for eDiets Content. Women.com reserves the right to reject any and all content that does not meet Women.com's editorial guidelines. eDiets will then be required to edit such content until all content provided by eDiets complies with Women.com's editorial guidelines and standards.
perturbation.changed_text: eDiets shall attempt to ensure that the eDiets Content generally aligns with Women.com's editorial guidelines. Women.com will provide eDiets with general editorial suggestions for eDiets Content. Women.com reserves the right to suggest changes to any content that may not fully align with Women.com's editorial guidelines. eDiets will then be encouraged to consider edits to such content to better align with Women.com's editorial guidelines and standards.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the legal obligation by replacing 'shall ensure' with 'shall attempt to ensure' and 'complies' with 'generally aligns,' making compliance discretionary rather than mandatory. The removal of 'specific' editorial guidelines eliminates a clear legal requirement, and replacing 'required to edit' with 'encouraged to consider edits' creates uncertainty about the binding nature of the edits. The change undermines the original intent of ensuring compliance, potentially leading to content disputes.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract/failure to comply with quality standards. The original clause was a condition of the agreement between the two companies and how they would ensure the content would follow specific guidelines.

perturbation.original_text: Women.com agrees that, except as may be reasonably necessary, it shall not mask, frame, overlay, impair or otherwise materially alter or affect the images, information, perception, service quality or security obtained from a eDiets Site once the link or equivalent pathway is selected or initiated.
perturbation.changed_text: Women.com will endeavor to avoid any unnecessary masking, framing, overlaying, impairing, or material alteration of the images, information, perception, service quality, or security obtained from an eDiets Site after the user clicks the link or equivalent pathway.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the legal obligation by replacing 'agrees that... it shall not' with 'will endeavor to avoid' and 'reasonably necessary' with 'unnecessary'. This makes the obligation suggestive rather than mandatory, and it shifts the burden of proof to the complainant. It replaces clear language around materially affecting the information, perception, service quality, or security with an ambiguous expectation to ‘endeavor to avoid.’
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract/failure to comply with quality standards. The original clause was a condition of the agreement between the two companies and how they would ensure the content would follow specific guidelines.

perturbation.original_text: Women.com shall make advertising reports generated by NetGravity available to eDiets either online or in some other mutually agreed upon format. Such reports shall contain the number of impressions and other metrics attributable to each general category of advertising specified in Exhibit B hereto, as well as such other information as eDiets may reasonably request, to the extent reasonable commercial efforts and current technology permit.
perturbation.changed_text: Women.com will attempt to provide advertising reports generated by NetGravity to eDiets, potentially online or in an alternative format if feasible. These reports may include impression numbers and other metrics for advertising categories in Exhibit B, along with information eDiets requests, depending on commercial efforts and available technology.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the obligation for providing advertising reports. 'Shall make...available' becomes 'will attempt to provide,' making the action discretionary. 'Shall contain' becomes 'may include,' indicating the report's contents are not guaranteed. 'To the extent reasonable commercial efforts and current technology permit' is also altered, suggesting fulfilling report requests depends on effort and technology constraints, potentially limiting crucial data for eDiets.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract/failure to comply with reporting requirements. The original clause created a specific agreement on how reports would be shared with eDiets.
